data.title: Good Sandwiches, Fast and Friendly Service
data.text:
If you're looking for a good, made fresh sandwich for a quick lunch, then Steamboat is the place for you. I believe they make their own bread. For those of you that are familiar with a muffulettas from New Orleans, the bread at Steamboat is very similar. 

The ingredients are fresh and they make the sandwiches in about the time it takes you to pay. Family owned and operated with friendly service and reasonable prices. 

A very good place for lunch.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: I think they are probably an easy stop for locals that work downtown. I stopped in at 10:30 a.m. and got a sandwich, chips and drink. I thought the sandwich was good.  The bread is baked fresh each morning. You would not go here for the atmosphere but the dining area was clean.  It's an alternative to all the tourist type restaurants down town.

data.title: Super sandwiches indeed!
data.text: While staying at the Chattanoogan, I decided to take a walk down market street! This little jewel was just a street over and the sandwich was delicious... Fresh ingredients... Yummy orange tea... And eating it on a beautiful day in Miller Park. Perfect way to spend my 'day away from it all.'

data.title: Signature Sandwich is the BEST
data.text: This is a wonderful family owned sandwich shop.  Everything is home made and the very best is the signature sandwich - The Steamboat!!  Their meal deals are terrific!  I highly recommend stopping by and picking up a sandwich and cookie :)   You'll definitely come back

data.title: Good services
data.text:
Last time I came here together with a friend and I had a club sandwiches, it was a windy day and the waiter was so nice that he served us with two cups of warm water!

Well, the sandwiches was so far so good, you know, it tasted like the kind of oridinary kind of sandwiches from all other restaurants, btw the fillings were big, so i was very impressed.

data.title: Free Cookie on Friday
data.text:
My co-workers like to go to Steamboat on Fridays for the free cookie...well you have to buy a sandwich, chips and a drink to get it "free." Steamboat is close to the Tivoli on the opposite side of the street one block further away from the river. The front of the building is very nondescript..nothing to draw the eye. The same is true for the inside. 

Upon entering stand in line at the counter at the left, place your order with one of the eager staff...then pay the person at the register...you have a selection of bottled coke or unlimited fountain sodas. I had the Steamboat Sandwich ($4.50), a combination of roast beef, salami, ham, swiss cheese, mayo, pickles and buffalo hot sauce. You have the choice of white or wheat bread that is cut from a large loaf. A very tasty sandwich.

data.title: Just okay is a compliment
data.text: This looks very inviting from the street. Inside it is average at best and that is after you wade through the junk boxes and clutter in the foyer which could easily be a fire hazard. After you order and pass through these eyesores, the back part is pleasant. It seems to be a local favorite for well dressed business people, both for eat in and to-go orders. The counter service is efficient and pleasant. Potato soup needed a lot of salt and pepper at the table as it was tasteless and potatoes were crunchy. Salad was decent as it had a variety of toppings.

data.title: I love their sandwhiches
data.text: I have visited this location and the one on shallowford. The sandwhiches are great. The bread is home made and fresh each day. This location stays very busy at lunch during weekdays due to being downtown with all the office. This location is not near as good as shallowford location.

data.title: Not Great Anything
data.text:
It is a basic office building sandwich place. Everything appears to be prepackaged from the big distributors. I got the "Southwest Sandwich" but here was nothing Southwest about it. The bread was good but the chicken was tiny in comparison and obviously was frozen. It also was a Buffalo flavored one which was not what I was expecting.  I also got the loaded Patato" soup. Nothing loaded about it and it was watery and bland to boot.

This is pretty much a place to go and get a quick bite of you don't care.

data.title: Overpriced/bland
data.text: I want to apologize to my friend who LOVES this place... but I've given it three separate tries and just can't bring myself to go back.  Food is about as good as Jimmy Johns... which says alot.  Very slow service two of the tree times I've gone.

data.title: Good Food but Overpriced
data.text: I am a local.  I visited this sandwich shop regularly since I worked in the office building next door.  The food is good and the service is good.  However, I thought the prices were a little high.

data.title: Good sandwich shop
data.text: Very good soups and sandwiches - fresh breads.  Artisan style breads, fresh ingredients, pack a lot of flavor.  Good for a quick lunch.  Price is reasonable.
